column4: I really need someone to help me fix my resolution.  I followed the wiki and it's not working
what's the problem ?
all I have is 640x480, i'm also having problems with my nvidia.  I followed the wiki for that too and it's not working either
have you tried "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" ?
let me try
just stick with the defaults (press enter) for all but the resolution
now what?
did you change to the resolution you wanted ?
yup, added the ones I want.  restart computer?
log out, log in should be sufficient, but sure, why not, I always perfer the reboot
okay, I'll be back if it doesn't work
didn't work
and you can't change it in System - Preferences - Screen Resolution ?
no, I had a hard time doing this before, I'
I'm putting ubuntu on a new computer
can you, on pastebin, paste your /etc/X11/xorg.conf  file
how do I get that again, and how do I get pastebin, it's been so long since I've had problems
now what did you want pasted there and how do I get that file?
gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf paste that
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/10024
what if you change the refresh rate, does that give you access to other resolutions ?
can't change refresh rate
when you did the dpkg-reconfigure, did you have an option of selecting "nvidia" as a driver and not "nv" ?
